oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Designed construction of mixed-metal, mixed chalcogenide clusters
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: MATHUR, P
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: cluster
chalcogen
mixed-metal
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Room temperature reactions between Fe-2(CO)(6)(mu -EE'), (E and E' = S, Se or Te) and M(CO)(5)(thf), M = Cr, Mo or W yield three types of clusters, the formation of each type clearly dependent on the nature of E and E' present in Fe-2(CO)(6)(mu -EE') and on the nature of M in M(CO)(5)(thf). While the Mo and W adducts are based on square pyramidal heavy atom cores, the Cr adduct has an unusual structure and can be considered as an inorganic analog of quadricyclane.
oai_dc:dc.dc:publisher: GORDON BREACH PUBLISHING, TAYLOR & FRANCIS GROUP
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: PHOSPHORUS SULFUR AND SILICON AND THE RELATED ELEMENTS, 136(), 535-540
